sections.heading: As used in this Act, unless the context otherwise requires:
sections.text: As used in this Act, unless the context otherwise requires:

sections.heading: A person likely to be damaged by a deceptive trade practice of
sections.text:
another may be granted injunctive relief upon terms that the
court considers reasonable. Proof of monetary damage, loss of profits or
intent to deceive is not required. Relief granted for the copying of an
article shall be limited to the prevention of confusion or misunderstanding
as to source.

sections.heading: This Act shall be construed to effectuate its general purpose to
sections.text: make uniform the law of those states which enact it.

sections.heading: This Act may be cited as the Uniform Deceptive Trade Practices Act.
sections.text: This Act may be cited as the Uniform Deceptive Trade Practices Act.

sections.heading: If any provision of this Act or the application thereof to any
sections.text:
person or circumstances is held invalid, the invalidity does not affect
other provisions or applications of the Act which can be given effect
without the invalid provision or application, and to this end the
provisions of this Act are severable.
